content: times 26 sts row 56 p2tog to end 13 sts row 57 p1 p2tog 6 times 7 sts icord knit nub with remaining 7 stitches to length required draw thread through the remaining stitches and use needle to pull thread through the nub fasten securely making up weave or sew in all loose ends knitting skills expected cast on knit plain k purl p stitches decrease by knitting 2 together k2tog or by purling 2 together p2tog rib i cord hint stitch markers can be used to keep track of decreases wool needle to darn in the ends on completed beret should be blunt so as to not split the yarn when knitting in the round always place a marker at the beginning of the round when joining the round - make certain to not twist the stitches lay the work flat on the table and turn the stitches so that the cast on edge is in the centre of the circle then join and continue to knit in the round this pattern may not be sold or distributed in any form you may knit the garment for sale as long as i am acknowledged as the designer the pdf versions of this pattern is available through etsy at http //www etsy com/shop/uniqueboutiqueknits or at http //www ravelry com print versions of this electronic file is not authorized for sale or distribution connie@connielene com www connielene com
